qas.question: In which country was a war against France condsidered desirable?
What was the overarching Prussian motive in starting a war with France?

answers.text: unification of a great German empire

qas.question: Who had no doubts that a Franco-German war was totally necessary?
Who did Bismarck feel needed to be viewed as the aggressor in the conflict?
In bringing the southern German states to align with Prussia, what tactical outcome was achieved?

context: In <a0_0>Prussia<a0_0/>, some officials considered a war against France both inevitable and necessary to arouse German nationalism in those states that would allow the <a1_0>unification of a great German empire<a1_0/>. This aim was epitomized by Prussian <a2_0>Chancellor Otto von Bismarck<a2_0/>'s later statement: "I did not doubt that a Franco-German war must take place before the construction of a United Germany could be realised." Bismarck also knew that <a3_0>France<a3_0/> should be the aggressor in the conflict to bring the southern German states to side with Prussia, hence giving <a4_0>Germans numerical superiority<a4_0/>. Many Germans also viewed the French as the traditional destabilizer of Europe, and sought to weaken France to prevent further breaches of the peace.
